alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Albany County through 600 PM MDT... At 500 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Baldy Peak, or 18 miles north of Laramie, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laramie, University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium and Baldy Peak. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 309 and 321. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
